questions.text: Among the following options, which is an active metabolite of hydroxyzine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cetirizine It is a metabolite of Hydroxyzine, Cetirizine is an antihistamine that reduces the natural chemical histamine in the body. Histamine can produce symptoms of sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose. It is used to treat cold or allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, or runny nose. Cetirizine is also used to treat itching and swelling caused by hives.

questions.text: A patient comes to you with allergic rhinitis and his work requires constant attention. Which of the following drugs would you prescribe him?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Loratidine Loratidine belongs to a group of medicines called antihistamines. It is used in the treatment of various allergic conditions. It relieves symptoms like itching, swelling and rashes. Loratidine is a second-generation antihistamine with no sedation effects, so this is preferred in persons requiring constant attention in their work like truck drivers.

Highyeild:

Loratadine Another long-acting selective peripheral H1 antagonist lacks CNS depressant effects and is fast acting. It is partly metabolized by CYP3A4 to an active metabolite with a longer t½ of 17 hr but has not produced cardiac arrhythmia in overdose, though seizures are reported. No interaction with macrolides or antifungals has been noted. Good efficacy has been reported in urticaria and atopic dermatitis.
